Class DownData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.DownData
public final class DownData extends Object
- Immutable value object returned after a downward movement (soft drop or hard drop). Contains: - the result of any line clearing, - the updated ViewData for rendering, - and an optional copy of the board (used for hard drop only). - This class does not expose any mutable state and acts purely as a data transfer object (DTO) between the logic and UI layers.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData)
    Constructs a DownData object (for convenience, to be removed) with basic information.
    DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData, boolean pieceLanded)
    Constructs a DownData object with information about row clearing, view updates, and piece landing status.
    DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData, int[][] board)
    Constructs a DownData object (for convenience, to be removed) with cleared rows, view data, and board matrix, assuming no piece landed.
    DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData, int[][] board, boolean pieceLanded)
    Constructs a DownData object with comprehensive information including cleared rows, view updates, an optional board matrix, and piece landing status.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int[][]
    getBoard()
    Returns an optional copy of the game board matrix.
    ClearRow
    getClearRow()
    Returns the ClearRow object containing details about any cleared lines.
    ViewData
    getViewData()
    Returns the ViewData object containing the current state of the game for rendering.
    boolean
    isPieceLanded()
    Indicates whether the piece landed and was locked into the board during the downward movement.

  • Constructor Details

    • DownData

      public DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData, boolean pieceLanded)
      Constructs a DownData object with information about row clearing, view updates, and piece landing status. The board matrix is implicitly null for this constructor.
      Parameters:
      clearRow - Information about cleared rows, or null if none were cleared.
      viewData - The updated view data.
      pieceLanded - True if the piece landed and was locked, false otherwise.

    • DownData

      public DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData, int[][] board, boolean pieceLanded)
      Constructs a DownData object with comprehensive information including cleared rows, view updates, an optional board matrix, and piece landing status.
      Parameters:
      clearRow - Information about cleared rows, or null if none were cleared.
      viewData - The updated view data.
      board - An optional copy of the game board matrix.
      pieceLanded - True if the piece landed and was locked, false otherwise.

    • DownData

      public DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData)
      Constructs a DownData object (for convenience, to be removed) with basic information. Assumes no piece landed and no board matrix is provided.
      Parameters:
      clearRow - Information about cleared rows, or null.
      viewData - The updated view data.

    • DownData

      public DownData(ClearRow clearRow, ViewData viewData, int[][] board)
      Constructs a DownData object (for convenience, to be removed) with cleared rows, view data, and board matrix, assuming no piece landed.
      Parameters:
      clearRow - Information about cleared rows, or null.
      viewData - The updated view data.
      board - An optional copy of the game board matrix.

  • Method Details

    • getClearRow

      public ClearRow getClearRow()
      Returns the ClearRow object containing details about any cleared lines.
      Returns:
      The ClearRow object, or null if no lines were cleared.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Returns the ViewData object containing the current state of the game for rendering.
      Returns:
      The ViewData object.

    • getBoard

      public int[][] getBoard()
      Returns an optional copy of the game board matrix. This is primarily used after a hard drop to update the background.
      Returns:
      A 2D integer array representing the game board, or null if not provided.

    • isPieceLanded

      public boolean isPieceLanded()
      Indicates whether the piece landed and was locked into the board during the downward movement.
      Returns:
      True if the piece landed, false otherwise.
